title: JP Morgan Affiliates to Pay $151 Million to Resolve SEC Enforcement Actions
J.P. Morgan Fined $3M for Misreporting 77 Billion Shares - Yahoo Finance
J.P. Morgan to Pay $150M to Settle Slew of SEC Charges - Wealth Management
JP Morgan affiliates to pay $151M to resolve SEC enforcement actions - Nasdaq
FINRA fines J.P. Morgan Securities for alleged rule violations
reasoning: The Securities and Exchange Commission has charged J.P. Morgan Securities LLC and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. for various failures, including misleading disclosures and breaches of fiduciary duty. They will pay a total of $151 million to resolve these charges.
The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) has imposed a fine of $3 million on J.P. Morgan for inaccuracies in systemwide reporting that date back over 16 years.
J.P. Morgan is set to pay more than $150 million to settle various SEC charges against its investment management and securities arms.
The SEC has charged J.P. Morgan Securities and J.P. Morgan Investment Management with multiple violations, leading to significant financial penalties.
J.P. Morgan Securities has been fined by FINRA for alleged regulatory violations, contributing to the ongoing scrutiny of the firm.
